metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7030 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
FreeIPA uses a default password policy that locks an account after 5unsuccessful authentication attempts, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service by locking out the account in which systemservices run on.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7030` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-client - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-common - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.4.4-1
freeipa-tests - 4.4.4-1
python-ipaclient - 4.4.4-1
python-ipalib - 4.4.4-1
python-ipaserver - 4.4.4-1
python-ipatests - 4.4.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: freeipa package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.4-1').
